inlineContent.text: Most basic 3D game object, with a
and visibility settings. All other 3D game objects inherit from
as a parent node to move, scale, rotate and show/hide children in a 3D project.
Affine operations (rotate, scale, translate) happen in parent’s local coordinate system, unless the
object is set as top-level. Affine operations in this coordinate system correspond to direct affine operations on the
’s transform. The word local below refers to this coordinate system. The coordinate system that is attached to the
object itself is referred to as object-local coordinate system.
Unless otherwise specified, all methods that have angle parameters must have angles specified as
. To convert degrees to radians, use
Be aware that “Spatial” nodes are now called “Node3D” starting with Godot 4. Any Godot 3.x references to “Spatial” nodes refer to “Node3D” in Godot 4.
This object emits the following signals:

abstract.text: Most basic 3D game object, parent of all 3D-related nodes.
Sets whether the node ignores notification that its transformation (global or local) changed.
A unit quaternion used for representing 3D rotations.
Overrides the location sounds are heard from.
Generic 3D position hint for editing.
Moves the global (world) transformation by
offset. The offset is in global coordinate system.
Rotates the local transformation around axis, a unit
, by specified angle in radians.

Forces the transform to update. Transform changes in physics are not instant for performance reasons. Transforms are accumulated and then set. Use this if you need an up-to-date transform when doing physics operations.
Manages the game loop via a hierarchy of nodes.
Returns whether this node uses a scale of
or its local transformation scale.
Attach an editor gizmo to this
The parent class of all OpenXR composition layer nodes.
Rotates the local transformation around axis, a unit
, by specified angle in radians. The rotation axis is in object-local coordinate system.
Starting distance from which the GeometryInstance3D will be visible, taking
into account as well. The default value of 0 is used to disable the range check.
A node containing a bone hierarchy, used to create a 3D skeletal animation.

to the identity matrix).

3D obstacle used to affect navigation mesh baking or constrain velocities of avoidance controlled agents.

Types that conform to VariantRepresentable can be stored directly in
with no conversion.  These include all of the Variant types from Godot (for
example
), Godot objects (those that subclass
SwiftGodot.Object) as well as the built-in Swift types UInt8, Int64 and Double.
Node for 3D tile-based maps.
А node that dynamically copies or overrides the 3D transform of a bone in its parent
Scales the local transformation by given 3D scale factors in object-local coordinate system.
nodes receive this notification when their visibility changes.
Node supporting hand and finger tracking in OpenXR.
Parent of all visual 3D nodes.
Resets this node’s transformations (like scale, skew and taper) preserving its rotation and translation by performing Gram-Schmidt orthonormalization on this node’s
Clears subgizmo selection for this node in the editor. Useful when subgizmo IDs become invalid after a property change.

Defines the visibility range parent for this node and its subtree. The visibility parent must be a GeometryInstance3D. Any visual instance will only be visible if the visibility parent (and all of its visibility ancestors) is hidden by being closer to the camera than its own
. Nodes hidden via the
property are essentially removed from the visibility dependency tree, so dependent instances will not take the hidden node or its ancestors into account.
If
, the node will not inherit its transformations from its parent. Node transformations are only in global space.
Types that conform to VariantStorable can be stored in a Variant and can be extracted
back out of a Variant.
Changes the node’s position by the given offset
in local space.
nodes receive this notification when their local transform changes. This is not received when the transform of a parent node is changed.
Rotation part of the global transformation in radians, specified in terms of YXZ-Euler angles in the format (X angle, Y angle, Z angle).
Sets whether the node uses a scale of
or its local transformation scale. Changes to the local transformation scale are preserved.
